text:
Honored guests, members of the
HBS faculty, staff, alumni,

and students, let
me again welcome you

to the diploma ceremony for
the Harvard Business School
class of 2023.
[APPLAUSE]
My name is Matt Weinzierl.

I'm the Faculty Chair
of the MBA program.

And I'm Jana Pompadur Kirstead,
Executive Director of the MBA
and Doctoral Programs.

And together, Matt and
I have the privilege

of stewarding the
HBS MBA program

and today, of opening the
ceremony in which we celebrate
your success.

And before we
continue, we would like

to say something else to
celebrate some of our partners
in leading these programs.

Professor Dennis Yao
and Jen Mucciarone.

Jen Mucciarone, Dennis and Jen,
who lead our Doctoral Program.
[APPLAUSE]

Matt's predecessor and my
former partner in crime,

the faculty chair who welcomed
the class of 2023 to campus

and did so much to support
their experience, Professor Jan
Rivkin.
Please join us in thanking Jan.
[APPLAUSE]

As our graduating
students will tell you,

we often speak, often speak,
of the transformational power
of an HBS education.

And transformations can
be readily apparent.

I imagine many of you are
hearing from your friends

and loved ones how much they've
seen you grow and change over
the time you've been here.

But transformations can also
be internal, visible only
to ourselves.

And in the case, maybe
uniquely, of an HBS education,

the transformation
you've experienced

can take years, even decades,
to be fully realized.

Now, we can say from
experience from those

who've walked these paths and
halls before you that even

if it's not
immediately apparent,

we know that transformation
is deep inside you.

And we know this for
at least three reasons.

The first is because we
know that the hundreds

of class sessions,
the dozens of courses

from National Cranberry,
to Everest, to your 75 page

BGIE cases, from CMFS,
to CVCR, to CMC, to ALD,

to MITI, and even EC courses
without acronyms, they have all

developed not only your
knowledge about the world

but your judgment and
your decision making.

Second, because we know that
the thousands of debates

and discussions you had,
whether in Aldrich, or Hawes,

or Spangler, or the grill, or
Klarman, or even the tunnels,

have given you the
reflex, that instinct

to listen to each other,
to listen for perspectives

and views before making those
judgments and decisions.

And then third and
finally, because we

know that the
constant reinforcement

of the idea that
as HBS graduates,

you now have not just
the opportunity but also

the responsibility to use that
judgment and decision making

to lead, has raised your
expectations for what

difference you can
make in the world.

And so we know for those
reasons that within each of you

are planted those seeds
of transformation that

will bloom throughout
your lives and careers,

both as individuals and
together as the class of 2023.

Over the next couple of
hours up on this stage,

you will see staff
and faculty who

lead the MBA and
doctoral programs,

alumni whose achievements
inspire us all, and, of course,

each of the more than
1,000 students who

are about to go off into
the world as HBS graduates

and cherished members
of our HBS community.

First, we have the
distinct pleasure

of calling on the leader of
that community, whose vision,

commitment, and enthusiasm
set an example for all
of us, our Dean Srikant Datar.
Dean.
[APPLAUSE]
We can do that.

Dean Datar, it's our honor
to present to you the 26

doctoral students, the
991 MBA students who

have fulfilled their
requirements for graduation.
Together, they are--

A class that hails
from 72 countries.

A class that includes the full
palette of human diversity,
talent, and potential.

A class whose
doctoral graduates are

expanding the frontier
of human understanding

and creating the ideas
that future generations

of our students and
others will study.

A class whose MBA
graduates have invested

in their capacity to
lead through hard work,
with humility, and for humanity.

A class eager and able to make
a difference in the world.

Dean Datar, we present to
you the HBS Class of 2023.
[APPLAUSE]
